DataElement.preferredDefinition: the name of a hospital or health care facility administering treatment after protocol-specified treatment ends but prior to completion of the follow-up period.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the hospital or health care facility administering treatment given after protocol-specified treatment ends but prior to completion of the follow-up period.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Off-Treatment; the phase of a protocol during which a patient does not receive treatment.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: When a patient is not receiving therapy they are considered off treatment.  In clinical trials, a dosing schedule may require a patient to stop medication for a period of time, then resume, such as 28 days on and 7 days off.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: Treating; providing treatment for.:No value exists.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the name of the organization entering patients on a clinical trial.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: groups, institutions, or clinical facilities that conduct clinical research or tests, or analyze clinical data.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided.:Personal names, given or surname, as cultural characteristics, as ethnological or religious patterns, as indications of the geographic distribution of families and inbreeding, etc. Analysis of isonymy, the quality of having the same or similar names, is useful in the study of population genetics. NAMES is used also for the history of names or name changes of corporate bodies, such as medical societies, universities, hospitals, government agencies, etc.

Concepts.definition: The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided.

A word or group of words indicating the identity of a person usually consisting of a first (personal) name and a last (family) name with an optional middle name. In some cultural traditions the family name comes first.

DataElement.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form
